thread.title: Sideline: Honors for UCA volleyball; UCA soccer and CCS 7th football
thread.title_full: Sideline: Honors for UCA volleyball; UCA soccer and CCS 7th football

author: Staff
title: Sideline: Honors for UCA volleyball; UCA soccer and CCS 7th football
text:
Sideline: Honors for UCA volleyball; UCA soccer and CCS 7th football Posted: October 19, 2015 - 6:13pm UCA’s Schnars Player of Week 
University of Central Arkansas outside hhitter Heather Schnars was named the Southland Conference’s Offensive Player of the Week for her play in two victories by the Sugar Bears. 
It was her third offensive honors in for weeks for Schnars. She tallied a match high in both of Central Arkansas’ straight-set victories on the week. Against Lamar on Thursday, the Downey, Calf. (Downey HS), native hit .415 on her way to 20 kills in three sets, while adding a service ace. Then on Saturday at Sam Houston State, she collected 14 kills while hitting .344 and adding a trio of assists. Islanders down Bears on late goal 
Kelly Kristin’s goal with 90 second left Sunday gave Texas A&M-Corpus Christi (3-9-2, 3-4-1) a 2-1 victory Sunday over the University of Central Arkansas’ women’s soccer team (6-8-1, 3-4-1). 
Camille Bassett s scored for UCA in the fourth minute, her seventh goal of the season. 
It was the final home match for the Bears. They have road contests this weekend at Southeastern Louisiana and Nicholls. CCS 7th-graders down Quitman 
Robert Taylor scored four touchdowns last week in leading Conway Christian’s seventh grade to a 32-20 football victory over Quitman. 
Jordan Hogrefe was a defensive standout.
